The Anagram logo was designed by the Spanish artist Vicente Vela as a quadruple-L insignia that now lends instant recognition to any Loewe piece. The motif punctuates the spherical toe post on these black sandals.

product_name: SL/80 high-top leather and suede sneakers
description: For a stealthy yet clean option for everyday wear, look to the SL/80 sneakers from Saint Laurent. The high-top design is dressed in a white and gray color scheme, and comes constructed in leather with contrast suede trims, while featuring a logo design on the heel counters.
These slides from Burberry are defined by its cotton canvas upper featuring a checked pattern and cutout detailing. The style has a contoured rubber insole for ultimate comfort.

The effortlessly elegant Sifnos sandals are made from crossed straps of black and brown leather. This piece features the extremely elegant Scritto motif, created by Olga Berluti as an homage to the art of calligraphy.

The Paquepapa No Back from Christian Louboutin expertly blends two footwear classics: espadrilles and penny loafers. Crafted from suede with croc-effect leather heels that fold down, this style has refined uppers and jute soles.
Maison Margiela brings its signature Tabi split toe to a pair of classic low-top sneakers. Made from white canvas, the design has contrast topstitching and the brand's numerical logo on the tongues.

Calling to mind the chunky styles of an earlier era, the MA-1 sneakers from Amiri have wide laces and oversized tongues. They’re made from panels of leather with mesh inserts and perforated uppers to ensure airflow.
